description: From Old French contagieus, from Late Latin contagiosus, from contagio.

adjectives.description: contagious (comparative more contagious, superlative most contagious)

entries.meaning: (of a disease) Easily transmitted to others.
examples: Hypernyms: infectious, communicable, transmissible, spreadable, catching
Last year's flu strain was so contagious that everybody in town got sick!
Wearing jeans was a contagious fad at that time.

entries.meaning: (of a person) Having a disease that can be transmitted to another person.
examples: They were highly contagious, spreading bacteria to other people.
